intro: Trichophyllum ochreatum, commonly known as the yellow star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and bright yellow to orange-green coloration. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along its stems. Trichophyllum ochreatum typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
